snippet: The trial of a senior official of the Philadelphia Archdiocese has begun, finally putting the issue of responsibility front and center.
abstract: Editorial contends that the trial of Monsignor William J Lynn, a senior official of the Philadelphia Archdiocese accused of covering up the sex abuse of children by Catholic priests, is a long overdue step in forcing the church to take responsibility for the scandals; notes that it is the first-ever trial of a diocesan supervisor for allegedly covering up the scandal.
lead_paragraph: The trial of a senior official of the Philadelphia Archdiocese has begun, finally putting the issue of responsibility front and center.
